name: Hampshire Hotel - Rembrandt Square Amsterdam

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for a short break (just two nights) with a friend. It was easy to get to from the cental station and the location was fantastic. It is about 10 minutes walk to Damm Square, but has lots of shops and restaurants very close to it. It is right on the canal side and has a lovely bar to enjoy a drink at either the beginning or end of an evening. We booked a superiour room and it was clean tidy and had a lovely large bathroom. The best thing of all though were the beds, probably the most comfortable I have ever had in a hotel!!! It was my first time in Amsterdam and I would love to return for a longer break and would definately go back to the hotel Eden.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

likes.liked: — The comfort of the beds - fantastic
likes.disliked: — Not enough coffee sachets in the room

reviews.text: Located about 10 min walk from centre of amsterdam and 10 min walk to heineken museum etc. Room was small but adequate, decoration modern and very clean.
reviews.title: Good hotel in good location

reviews.text: Got an excellent price by booking on the hotel website on a no cancellation option.
reviews.title: Great modern hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is in an excellent location with very clean modern rooms and very comfortable beds. There was a big street party when I was there with a lot of loud music but you couldn't hear a thing inside the room. The staff were very friendly. The only downside was a very slow check-out but I would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Awesome boutique hotel close to gay scene

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights during Amsterdam Pride. It was well worth the price. Comfortable and modern and extremely convenient to gay events happening this weekend. But it would be a great location for anyone as it is close to the sights and can be reached easily via tram from Central Station. Will stay at this location again when I return to Amsterdam in October. Enjoy!!
reviews.title: Great hotel, loved it

reviews.text: In a city where year-round excess demand means hoteliers can get away with murder, the Eden Rembrandt still represents poor value for money. Rooms are cramped (but then I suppose you have to expect that in crowded Amsterdam) but the little details that make a good hotel were missing. It was difficult to get the coffee and tea replenished each day, bathroom facilities were poor, service in the bar could be painfully slow, the reception advertised public transport passes but never had any in stock each time I asked for one - and I was staying on business for a week!!
reviews.title: Could do better

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights with my elderly parents and we all agree it was a very good experience. We arrived early (check in is from 3) but were able to leave our luggage in the luggage store. The concierge is very pleasant with a good sense of humour. The rooms were fine if a little on the small side but the beds were extemely comfortable. Breakfast was included for us and was excellent. There is a wide choice ranging from ham cheese and croissants to cereal, bacvon and eggs and unlimited tea/coffee. The location is good, just minutes from the trams in Rembrantplein or you can walk a bit further to Muntplein, depending on where you are going. The location is quiet and we were not disturbed by noise on any of the nights we stayed. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: comfortable and good breakfast

reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel that American travelers will identify with - by that, I mean it was air conditioned and nicely appointed. Modestly sized for European hotels, it was very comfortable for one or two people. The room was very clean.
reviews.title: Very comfortable; central location

reviews.text: The decor is modern. Interestingly, the shower area had a glass wall that was shared with the sleeping area. Modesty is preserved through strategically placed glass frosting, but if you're traveling with a non-intimate friend you might be a bit uncomfortable. Also, the bathroom had a bottle opener on the wall, which I thought very considerate (it probably avoids damage to the surfaces - who among us have not found novel ways of opening bottles?).
reviews.title: Realy nice hotel, enjoyed staying there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room included an in-room safe that fit a 15" laptop (much appreciated), and a mini-bar (which I didn't use). A flat panel TV with several English channels was included. Free internet was provided, which is unique in European hotels.
reviews.title: Above Average For Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for our Wedding Anniversary at the beginning of October. Booked after reading other reviews. Everyone right - beds extremely comfortable and room well equiped. Great location for exploring Amsterdam and not at all noisy. Hotel not attractive to look at but inside fine. Concierge helpful in booking restaurant, Zuid Zealand (excellent and expensive).
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would defintely stay here again if visiting Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

likes.disliked: — The room is cold when you get in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a nice hotel. At first, we were surprised how soft the beds were. But they are very confortable. The hotel is close to the tram, the flower market, and there's a nice street for the shopping.
reviews.title: Snug as a bug in a rug!

reviews.text: Just got back from three nights in this hotel and what was, on the whole, a really enjoyable stay. We arrived to discover that we had been upgraded to a junior suite, as we were celebrating a 50th birthday - the receptionist even wished my husband 'Happy Birthday' when we checked in!
reviews.title: Awfull, never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was so pleased with the room, as others have stated, the beds were amazingly comfortable with great big soft pillows, and our room was sooooo quiet. The decor was very modern (in fact it was very grey!!!)) and we just had so much space. The bathroom was simply amazing.(I really like getting a nice bathroom when on holiday and I wasn't disappointed!!) We had a huge bath with and adjustable shower head, plus a wet room part with a huge rain shower and another adjustable shower head - incredible!!!! (there was even a bottle opener screwed to the wall of the wet room - a nice touch if you want a beer with your bath!!) Lovely toiletries, big fluffy towels, such luxury!!!
reviews.title: Ideal Roomy and Quiet Accommodation

likes.liked: — High standard accommodation away from the hustle and bustle

reviews.text: Stayed 8th - 10th Aug 2006, 2 adults + 2 teenagers.
reviews.title: Reasonablle,good location.

reviews.text: Booked 2 rooms through expedia, flights booked with Thompsonfly(--). Hotel in good position close to main attractions, very accessable by tram/ taxi from cent station, metro line at Waterlooplein 200m away. Hotel modern, comfortable and clean. Both rooms we had were very comfortable & clean but different although next to each other, ie 1 room did not have a bath. On arrival found reception/ concierge very helpful but after change of shift found the reception unhelpful (appeared stressed) concierge missing ( one couple waiting for bags for 25min before he was found!). Restaurant attached to hotel overpriced and service poor much better available around Rembrandtplien.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rembrandtplatien - located centrally to all attractions and well served by tram/ canalbus, good restaurants & bars in area.
reviews.title: A Great Suprise!! Would definitely stay here again

likes.disliked: — worth it if you can get for under 180 euros

reviews.title: A Good Find
reviews.text: Anne Frank museum a must takes approx 1 1/2 hrs, pre purchase tickets available for evenings or expect to queue for 1hr +.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights and had a great time. Hotel is modern, clean and quiet. Rooms are comfortable though some lights did not work and the open glass toilet/shower is a bit OTT.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: Amsterdam was really lively and lots to do. For a good value on-the-run lunch try La Place next the VB Dept Store at the Munt Tower - an amazing variety of freshly prepared food and self service.
reviews.title: Great price, nice rooms, small breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would also recommend "de jaren" at 20-22 Nieuwe Doelenstraat - it feels like an ex university bar but the upstairs is very modern and the food was excellent and mostly organic and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Good Location, Great Rooms

likes.disliked: — Cleanliness of Street that Entrance opens onto

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights end August on the basis of reviews on this site and was slightly dissapointed. The location of the hotel is good, however the room was a triumph of style over substance. The bed was 2 twins pushed together, I had requested a double when I booked, their web site states twin or king. When I queried this with reception the girl said that they don't have any king sized beds!
reviews.title: Overrated & unfinished

reviews.text: The room itself was dingy, the aircon noisy, the carpet stained. The internet connection didn't work. The bathroom looked good, but the fittings were flimsy, there was no shower screen = slippy slate floor. There was nowhere to hang wet towels, and even some unpainted MDF on display.
reviews.title: Staff needs training

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a positive note, the staff were (mostly) friendly and helpful, Flo Bistro next door serves good seafood, although is very busy, & service was slow the night we visited.
reviews.title: geat hotel

reviews.text: My overall impression was that this hotel has opened too early. I think this hotel would be a great budget hotel, or a reasonable 3 star if they finished it, but I won't stay again.
reviews.title: Great Find, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in August in the Eden Rembrandt Square. I booked a Non-Smoking room. During check in I was advised that no non-smoking room is available although I booked the room several month in advance. The receptionist just told me that this is only a request and nothing more. Not very friendly.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

likes.liked: — the new modern feel, location to everything and the friendly staff

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: From main train station is about 15 euros, don't pay more. Great location, next to Rembrandt Square. I am writing this sitting in the lobby of this hotel. Room is very small, but with newer, modern amenities. Plazma TV, excellent bed and bedding, onlike other European hotels bed is sitting high. Bathroom is nice, but no shower curtain. There is a french restaurant, but we found a nice italian restaurant not far from hotel. Guess we will try french tomorrow. Stuff is helpfull, but there is no bar in lobby. Room is so small, you can't lay down a small suit case on the floor. Furniture is nice and we don't care about walking space in the hotel room. Recommend and will stay again.

reviews.title: Terrific beds!!
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of a 5 night stay in Amsterdam. When we arrived outside the Hotel we had our doubts but once inside we were much happier. Location is pretty good for seeing the city.

reviews.title: Great hotel Great location
reviews.text: Our room had a view of the back yard which was pretty miserable & made the room look dark. The bathroom was terrific - ultra chic and the bath products were great. The beds are fantastic (one of the reasons we chose this hotel having read other reviews!!).

reviews.title: great room at the Eden
reviews.text: However, overall we thought the hotel lacked character.

reviews.title: Good location, great room and beds
reviews.text: Like most people here we loved this hotel. It may not look much from the outside or have great views from the rooms but it more than makes up for it in other ways. The Rembrandtplein is a great place to stay quieter than the busy city centre, yet has plenty of bars and restaurants locally. It is a pleasant 5 minute stroll into the busier heart of the city. The hotel itself is great I found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful and nothing seemed to be too much trouble for them. The room was great well appointed and finished to a very high standard. And as a few people have mentioned the beds are so comfortable, in fact when we got home we went to buy a new mattress as we felt we had been missing out on real comfort for so long. As someone mentioned the toilet doors are fine if you are a couple but may not provide enough privacy for some situations.

This is a great hotel. I have stayed here a couple of times and have had a really good time. The standard rooms are quite small (although the upgraded rooms are huge) but have everything you need including free internet, comfortable beds, and great shower (no bath). There are direct trams from central station and it is right in the centre of Amsterdam. Rooms are clean and fashionably furnished (some looking very slightly warn).
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — room size and cost of breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is good but if it isn't in your room rate be warned it is about 17 Euros which is heafty. However, there is a nice coffee shop along the street.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel In Fantastic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will definitely stay again
reviews.title: overpriced and over rated

likes.disliked: — no ironing facilites in a so called 4 star

reviews.text: Have just returned from a four-night stay at the Eden Rembrandt Square. The hotel was in a great location, just far enough from lively Rembrandt Square to be quiet at night time. We walked from Central Station as the weather was lovely, but if it was raining, you might prefer to take the tram which drops you off less than one hundred meters from the hotel's front door.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was an adequate size and comfortable, with flat-screen TV with international channels. The glass doors into the bathroom and glass partition between the shower and bedroom are not a problem if you are staying with a spouse or partner, but may not be to everyone's taste. There is also a frosted panel across the middle of the glass. The beds are fantastically comfortable, and our room was quiet at night. The only things I could complain about were that housekeeping was a little noisy in the morning, and they only left one small bar of soap during the entire four-night stay, although other toiletries were replaced.
reviews.title: Nice hotel let down by attention to detail and communication between staff

likes.disliked: — Not enough attenton to detail, lack of communication

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Eden Rembrandt hotel - this week. All good things to say about the hotel:

reviews.title: Satisfied, but not impressed.
reviews.text: 1. Great location

reviews.title: Eden in Rembrandt Square
reviews.text: 2. Clean rooms

reviews.title: The best hotel I've stayed in in Europe
reviews.text: 3. Great bed!

reviews.title: Believe what you read - highly recommended
reviews.text: 4. Great bathrooms - large and modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Facts:
reviews.title: Very Very Nice and Modern!!!

likes.disliked: — though not a major problem, since the bath-tub doesnt't have a curtain or sthg. like that, the floor gets wetr

reviews.text: -Very modern, clean, comfortable room. (We went there with our friends, so we have seen that not all the rooms are the same in size, Our friends told us that we had the biggest room. It was a corner room, no. 594, fyi.)
reviews.title: very good up to check out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -I just loved the bed! It's incredibly comfortable.
reviews.title: Great location, fab beds!

likes.disliked: — Hotel restaurant quite expensive - go out for breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Bathroom has a glass door, but the toilet has a seperate door inside, so nothing to worry about :)
reviews.title: They get the important stuff right

likes.liked: — Size comfort, and quality of bedding and pillows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Coffee,tea maker in the room
reviews.title: The best beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very modern, from the flat screen TV, the furniture and the glass shower, which could be almost seen through when someone was taking the shower (hopefully someone you want to see). Comfortable beds, but for some reason two mattrasses in one bed. Looked really clean and nice. Just a short tram ride form the central station, right in the middle of the city. Short walk to almost everything.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: The hotel is located just off Rembrandtplein, which is a lovely square with bars and restuarants. Trams run from the Centraal Station right to the hotel and will take you the short journey up to Dam Square.
reviews.title: Trendy modern hotel- almost perfect!

reviews.text: The reception staff were friendly and efficient on my arrival at 7.45pm on Saturday evening and I was in my room in minutes. My room was located on the 3rd floor overlooking the street and a building site opposite! There was, however no noise from the building site although that may change in future. There was only a small amount of noise from passing trams and people staggering home at 4am. Nothing excessive though. If you want it really quiet you are probably better off asking for a room away from the street. The maid service was also a little noisy in the morning.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay at the Eden Rembrandt

likes.liked: — Rooms were very modern and clean.
likes.disliked: — Front desk but it was not a huge deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was well furnished with trendy modern decor and certainly was not small. There was one large double bed, a desk and chair, easy chair and foot stool and a great plasma TV which even had BBC1. There was a safe in the wardrobe although the instructions were only in Dutch. I am quite technologically minded but it took me 20 minutes to work out how to use it! The hotel guide was also only available in Dutch - unusual for The Netherlands. Tea and coffee making facilities were also provided in the room although these were not restocked during my stay and there was a minibar. The room was spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable. One of the light bulbs on the bedside table lamps had failed and this was not replaced during my stay.
reviews.title: Don't do it unless you like having your belongings stolen!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom, again, was spotless and very modern. The frosted glass door was a cool touch and the free toiletries were good quality. My only complaint here was that there was no shower curtain on the bath so the floor and toilet got wet when I showered.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!!

reviews.text: There were only a few reviews when we booked this hotel, all positive, and since then there has been many singing its praises, and we will join in the chorus.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since the hotel was so wonderful, let me begin with the problems. We actually had a little problem finding the hotel, there are no directions from the hotel website, and the duplicity of names of streets and hotels (there's a Best Western Eden around the corner) resulted in a couple of loop-de-loops around Rembrandtplein despite asking for directions. The hotel is not visible from the Square.
reviews.title: classy but resonable!!

likes.disliked: — SLOW BRINGING THE IRONING BOARD WHEN WE HAD A RESERVATION FOR DINNER

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 2 nights. On check in, the receptionist was very friendly and helpfully, explaining all fees and charges. The room was nice but quite small, it being a 4* hotel we expected more in size and quality. There was no real doors on the bathroom, only glass, shower like ones. This really got to me and I think its a terrible idea, the bathroom is a private place and you don't want your fellow traveller knowing what you get up to in there, even if it was my boyfriend!
reviews.title: Twas quite nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was not cleaned so we didn't get clean sheets or towels. This is probably because we didn't put the "make up my room" sign until 3pm but I personally feel this is ok seen as its a 4* hotel, they obviously don't agree though!
reviews.title: The worst Hotel i've ever been

reviews.text: Overall an enjoyable stay, just don't expect too much from this one!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: To begin with...the check in staff. The are de Kings and you a slave, so be careful. Snobs, non efficients and not willing to serve you. At least during the night shifte. If by any chance you feel the need to speak to the Duty Manager at a improper hour (let's say by 00h30) they say it's not possible. Nevertheless you can read at tne in-room info that there s a Duty Manager 24h a day. Not true.
reviews.title: Not quite a 4-star, with one serious deficiency

likes.disliked: — The bathroom door does not shut completely, poor ventilation

reviews.title: Good Location and Good Hotel
reviews.text: Imagine yourself reaching an hotel by 00h30 with a sleepy child with the reservation made for a double bed and a baby cot. And when you get to the room, there's no baby cot. Not nice, no ? Even worst, the reception staff just tells you there there is not a chance to get one that same night ! Is this the service you expect in a 4 star hotel in Europe ? I couldn't accept it.

description: Certified with the Golden Green Key.
